pros: Good pay, acceptable benefits. The mission and core values are outstanding.
cons: Employees are not held to an equal standard. Some people get away with frequent absences, gossip and lies. While focused hard working employees carry the load and take the abuse. HR is hands off. There is a very high turnover rate.

pros: Enjoyed working with the patient population
cons: At times low staffing at clinics

pros: Wonderful patients and clinical coworkers are amazing!
cons: Administration does not care about providers or staff.

review_title: Increasingly difficult to fit in, a factor in this could have been due to constant contact with company administrators.
pros: In a clinic setting the medical, support staff, and manager are fantastic to work with. Clean work spaces, and generally a good atmosphere.
cons: The benefits are not anything to brag about. High deductibles and outrageous added premiums if you want to add family members. Pay not adequate with the added responsibilities and stress admin puts on staff.

pros:
Serving the indent patient population, focus on quality! Tove Skaftun, Chief Nurse is AWESOME! 
Dr. Tocher is focused on the organization and quality key metrics. Both these leaders are the individuals driven to keep the organization focused! They can't do it all...
cons: Organization is not progressive.  Hires management that are "yes" men and women.  Half of the management lack a bachelors and only 2-3% have masters.  This the important educational foundation to strategically direct the organization.  Very top down!  Most of the management team had been at CHC for 15-20- therefore lack industry experience within the organization.  Dion Kapetenov is NOT a leader and stunts the organizational growth.  Lisa Miller lacks key leadership qualities that are integral to organizational development and growth.

pros: It is a med size company with good benefits. They have a family like feel to it.
cons: The pay is a little bit below average. It is hard to get raises some years since it is a non for profit

pros: Working to help and assist the less fortunate and under insured. You will get your hours only because this place cant keep staff.
cons: Ill be leaving. This is not a healthy work environment. Micromanaging is encouraged, poor work place attitude is acceptable as long as you brown nose and are favored. Workimg here at times is like is gossipy, clicky,  highschool. Really reconsider applying.
